snippet: The International Court of Justice said that Japan’s “scientific whaling” program in the Southern Ocean was illegitimate.
abstract: Decision by International Court of Justice in The Hague to ban Japan's annual whaling drive off Antarctica is a hard-won victory for conservationists who long argued that country's whaling research was a cover for commercial whaling; ruling halts program that has captured more than 10,000 minke and other whales in the Southern Ocean since 1988.

byline.original: By HIROKO TABUCHI and MARLISE SIMONS
byline.contributor: Hiroko Tabuchi reported from Tokyo, and Marlise Simons from Paris.

lead_paragraph: The International Court of Justice said that Japan’s “scientific whaling” program in the Southern Ocean was illegitimate.

headline.main: U.N. Court Orders Japan to Halt Whaling Off Antarctica
headline.print_headline: U.N. Court Orders Japan to Halt Whaling Off Antarctica
